mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Subject in letter of 9th entirely new to him; referred it to superintendent of city; his guess would be that the U.S. has no interest in the question and would take to part; question seems to be between heirs of Byrne & Beatty, which is entitled to price of the square; reserves opinion until he receives Superintendent's report.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1805 February 14, Washington [D.C.] to A. Ritchie, n.p.
